Draco support requires the Draco libraries, which are quite big (see table below). By default, these will be loaded from CDN but can optionally be bundled and supplied by the application through the top-level
The full Draco library (encode + decode, web assembly + IE11 javascript fallback).

Due to the size of the Draco libraries, a reasonable strategy for applications that wish to bundle their dependencies (e.g to avoid relying on a potentially flaky CDN) might be to bundle and supply only
, and still rely on the default setup to load the IE11 fallback library and the encoder code from CDN when needed.
